AppIdentifier.description: The package name is the unique identifier for the application. It is also the default name for the application process. Your current application identifier does not meet the requirements for Android apps and you will not be able to build and distribute Android application packages. To be able to build for Android, your application identifier must be unique and must begin with a lowercase letter. It must contain one or more strings, separated by a dot. Each string must start with a letter and might contain letters (A-Z, a-z), numbers (0-9) or underscores (_). The individual strings must not be Java keywords.
